meanings.sent1: The company overcommercializes their products, constantly pushing for more sales.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcommercializes her art, prioritizing profit over creativity.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual fair overcommercializes the holiday spirit with too many sponsored booths.
meanings.sent4: His constant need to overcommercializes every event turns life into a never-ending sales pitch.
meanings.sent5: The way he overcommercializes everything around him sucks the joy out of simple moments.

meanings.definition: To focus too much on commercial aspects
meanings.sent1: When businesses overcommercializes, they risk losing sight of their original purpose.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team tends to overcommercializes their campaigns, neglecting customer needs.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot twist was that the characters overcommercializes their own story for profit.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with overcommercializes every conversation turns interactions into sales pitches.
meanings.sent5: The way he overcommercializes every decision shows a lack of genuine connection with others.
